page.title: 01Farmland East of Loughton
page.content: The area which this block covers is in the main farmland. It is of mixed usage, with cattle, grassland and hay, small farms are not so common today, they have been swollowed up into larger esates. A small area within the block is residential, with housing and industry combined. The Bank Of England have premises where coins are minted, copy printing paper is also manufactured, there is also light engineering. The mill motorway also runs through this area a feature of this is an interchance where traffic can only exit and enter to and from London. The village of Abridge has not changed much over the years, no major development has taken place, and new building has been kept in line with existing old buildings.
